Call out link

Call out link

Highlight a single link within the page content.

On this page
  • Visual design
  • Guidelines for use
  • Layouts
  • Examples and assets

Visual design

Design view:

Mobile design

Desktop designs can be viewed on screens wider than 650px.

Call out links are often used for subscriptions and alerts.

CSS styles

Desktop & mobile

Link
a {
    color: #666666;
    font-family: OpenSans-Semibold;
    font-size: 16px;
    line-height: 24px;
    box-shadow: inset 0 -3.2px 0 #748FB8;
}
a:hover {
    box-shadow: inset 0 -20px 0 #DDEEFF;
}
icon
.icon {
    color: #254F90;
    height: 24px;
    width: 24px;
}
.icon-background {
    background-color: #E0E9F7;
    height: 64px;
    width: 64px;
    border-radius: 50%;
}
Container
.container {
    background-color: #F5F5F5;
    border-top: 4px solid #D8D8D8;
    padding: 32px 24px;
}

Guidelines for use

Purpose:

The call out link component highlights a single link in a call out box, with an icon to show the destination type (e.g. email subscription or web page).

When to use this component:

  • Call out links are generally used to promote subscription links for newsletters, updates and alerts.
  • They may be used on both index and content pages.

Layouts

Page layouts

Call out components can be used in full width and 2/3rd width pages.

Note: In full width layouts this component is centered on the page with a maximum width of 620px.

Component layout options

Full width layout

Desktop, Tablet & Mobile: One component in a row.
